item.title: Introduction to PostgreSQL Indexes
item.description: Who’s this for This text is for developers that have an intuitive knowledge of what database indexes are, but don’t necessarily know how they work internaly, what are the tradeoffs associated with indexes, what are the types of indexes provided by postgres and how you can use some of its more advanced options to make them more optimized for your use case. Basics Indexes are special database objects primarily designed to increase the speed of data access, by allowing the database to read less data from the disk.
